Turing Award 2019

Winners: Edwin Catmull, Pat Hanrahan

Computer Generated Imagery (CGI)

The Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) has named Patrick M. (Pat) H anrahan and Edwin E. (Ed) Catmull the winners of the 2019 ACM A.M. Turing Award. They are recognized for fundamental contributions to 3-D computer graphics, and the outstanding impact of these techniques on filmmaking.

What

Computer-generated imagery (CGI) is the branch of computer graphics that creates images in art, printed media, video games, simulators and computer animation. The images may be dynamic or static, and may be two-dimensional, even though the term "CGI" is most commonly used to refer to the tri-dimensional computer graphics used for creating characters, scenes and special effects.

In memory of A.M. Turing
